Pre-Game Insights: India are all set to square off against Afghanistan in the first match of the three-match T20I series at the Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium in Mohali on Thursday, January 11.
Rohit Sharma, the formidable Indian batter, leading the home side, while Ibrahim Zadran will command the Afghan squad.
India, coming off a T20I series against South Africa that concluded in a 1-1 draw, will be eager to make a strong statement on their home turf.
Rohit, known for his explosive batting and astute captaincy, will be key to India’s fortunes as they seek to gain an early advantage in the series.
On the opposing side, Afghanistan arrive with confidence riding high after a successful outing against the United Arab Emirates (UAE), where they clinched a 2-1 victory in the T20I series.
Zadran, at the helm of the Afghan team, will be looking to build on the team’s recent success and make a mark against a formidable Indian side.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at the Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium is a well-balanced track, providing opportunities for both batters and bowlers.
As the match progresses, batting becomes increasingly demanding, offering bowlers substantial assistance throughout the game.
Particularly in the later stages, spinners are expected to capitalize on the ground conditions.
Winning the toss, captains will likely opt to set a target rather than chasing, considering the challenges posed by the pitch dynamics at this venue.
Others: India: Rohit Sharma (c), Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Tilak Varma, Rinku Singh, Jitesh Sharma (wk), Sanju Samson (wk), Shivam Dube, Washington Sundar, Axar Patel, Ravi Bishnoi, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, Avesh Khan, Mukesh Kumar.

Afghanistan: Ibrahim Zadran (c), Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wk), Ikram Alikhil (wk), Hazratullah Zazai, Rahmat Shah, Najibullah Zadran, Mohammad Nabi, Karim Janat, Azmatullah Omarzai, Sharafuddin Ashraf, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Fareed Ahmad, Naveen Ul Haq, Noor Ahmad, Mohammad Saleem, Qais Ahmad, Gulbadin Naib and Rashid Khan.
